Im not vegan, but i found the food to be very flavorful. The churros blew my face off, it was so fresh and warm it couldn't be any better. I also tried their ice cream and it was so good, it was coconut based and is sourced locally which is awesome. The staff were so kind, they seemed to really care about us having a good experience.  It is a great grab and go spot for anytime of the day, if only they can be open 24 hours lol Overall, the food was great and everyone was really friendly. I have to go back and try everything else, they really exceeded my expectations it was great.

lEoWigUQbWszuMsyVKBAFg.text: I have eaten here like 5 times and have tried at least half of the menu. It's pretty much all been delicious. Friendly employees. I think they are cheap for the quality, and I'd be willing to pay more.

XhlDmAl75UnPlRatqww_vA.text: Let me start by saying I love tacos and tacos are life. I went to this place today on a recommendation. I am pro taco in every way, meaning I eat all types, meat, tongue, veg, intestine etc. tacos. This place is dope! I checked out the menu before I got there so that I wouldn't have to stand in line too long deciding. They have it all, and not just tacos but burritos, enchiladas, nachos and all manner of vegan Mexican options. Its crazy how good the menu is. their beverage selection is equally impressive. I will say I was disappointed that I couldn't get plain unsweetened ice tea, but the girl at the counter was awesome and upsold me beer! not only did she recommend beer, but went the next step and offered a sample to seal the deal. Really, don't tacos and beer just go together? yes, yes they do! Now, since this was my first time, you're probably thinking I only ordered a couple tacos to make sure I liked the place, wrong!! I ordered 4 different tacos, chips and salsa and that tasty cold beer. The first taco I ordered was the Gabacho, with seasoned beyond beef (insert trademark) lettuce, cheddar, crema and pico in a crispy corn tortilla. This one was delicious and very reminiscent of a Taco Bell taco, and that's not a bad thing because at 3 am you need tasty options. I then ordered the Barbacoa, which came with chili-braised jackfruit, onion and cilantro in a flour tortilla. Incredible, just incredible! jackfruit is my new jam! Thirdly, I think that's a word, I ordered the Dorado, deep fried mash potato, cheddar, lettuce, pico and crema in a crispy shell. This was good but not my favorite. Don't get me wrong, it was good, but in a taco competition it would be a runner up. My last taco was the Baja, deep fried avocado, cilantro-lime slaw, guac, pico and salsa Morita. Ding Ding Ding, this was the winner! I loved every taco I had but this was the best of the four I chose. everything on it played to the other ingredient, it was culinary magic in my mouth! I accompanied all of these tacos with chips and salsa. The chips were definitely made in house, crispy with just the right amount of salt, and paired with fresh salsa. Now I like my salsa spicy and this one wasn't but it was delicious and I was able to spice it up with 1 of 4 hot sauces they offer. I'll go into those on my next review. We got there too early for happy hour, which starts at 3, but it was well worth what we paid. Speaking of that, the prices are incredibly good considering the quality of food and the location. They aren't on the East side where I drove from, no, they are on the Southwest side of the valley where the rent runs a little higher. The girl who took our order was fantastic. I mentioned the upsell earlier. She was friendly and helpful and even recognized the band t shirt I was wearing, commenting on how she has seen them perform. I love when people make it personal. Overall this place is amazing and I will definitely be back and will also recommend it to all of my friends.

HYTK_Ckwp6NX0CWvb_anpg.text: We came here during opening week and while there are hiccups that you'd expect from any restaurants first few days, the food was top notch. We got the Baja, dorado, and Barbacoa tacos with Takis elote and everything was so delicious! Oh and I can't forget the coffee kombucha! So glad this is close to us because we'll be coming back for sure!

as57_AV7OTHSO2Skw5GLqQ.text: My wife and I went here recently after mountain biking out in Blue Diamond and we went crazy ordering.  The plant based taco offerings are so unique we just had to try 6 of them.  And I ordered the enchilada plate.  Everything was truly exceptional.  The guys working there were so friendly I incorrectly thought that they must own the place.  This place is fast casual located in a strip mall but it really was one of the most enjoyable meals I've had in a long time.  My wife got a margarita which was so good I was sad I ordered a beer.

eCVC2ZOgF-xSC51NnBkJ0w.text: We were in the mood for some tacos and decided to try out Tacotarian. We were blown away by the food. The kids had no idea that it was vegan. The super and the no carne asada were a hit with them as was the aqua fresca.  The place has great decor and an even better staff. The staff was warm and welcoming as if we were coming to their house for lunch. This place is a gem. You do not have to be vegan to enjoy the food. We will be back at least twice a month or any time we're on that side of town.

cwEETp3_FoKdPVSB2SN61g.text: I have been waiting for the place to open all summer! I live down the street and have been counting down to today. Everything so far was delicious and the staff was amazing! We finally have the type of Mexican joint that I have been waiting for in Las Vegas, and it happens to be down the street from me. The tacos were on the small side, but very good! (can't wait to try them all). The burrito and the rice and beans were all tasty. And the dessert! Finally, vegan conchas!!! Definitely check this place out, you won't be disappointed!

ImZYGJaLIrmzPPB8F103Iw.text: The food here is EXCELLENT. Every type of taco I've tried has been delicious, but the standouts have to be the Baja and and Dorado. ld6fr3BNaVOZ_hbj-ZDE3g.text: We've been to a couple other vegan Mexican restaurants, and this one is definitely good. I had the Cali burrito with the beyond beef. My children had the quesadillas, which I, of course, sampled. My partner had a regular burrito with the asada. There is another restaurant with asada that I find to be awful. My only complaints were the slow service and that they are so far away from my house (one which they can't control, so I'm whining because they are so good.)

It was huge and delicious and we could not believe it was vegan! We also tried a couple of the tacos and the rice and beans. Everything was great. I love the number of options on the menu. The staff was incredibly kind as well. It's also dog-friendly--there is outdoor seating and a water bowl for dogs. The only bad thing is if you are visiting Vegas it's probably a bit far. We went on the way back to CA so it wasn't too far off-track. Even if it's not on the way anywhere, it's totally worth the trek! I can't wait to go back on my next trip to Vegas.

eDfVmmqUAVPXP0aOLRjKmg.text: Best vegetarian place in town! Most of their offerings are made from plants other than soy & not processed fake "meat". You won't find any weird sauces here either. Everything is fresh and delicious! My favorites are the jackfruit ("pork") tacos and the avocado tacos ("fish"). The guacamole is the best in town - really fresh! It's a super cute place. Pretty dishes, fruit water, old movies screening on the wall & they always play cool, chill music. The staff is always attentive and very nice.

mWHjb0_b6jCQ9a9FVtwqcg.text: Tacotarian has a good-size menu, and even though some of their dishes are obviously cheap-filler type food, (Dorado taco is just a mashed potato taco with some toppings,) it's still healthier than the same price of filler food at McDonalds. And way tastier, in my opinion!  Their overall variety is pretty awesome, as well as their activity in the Vegas community and events. I had one of their special tortas from the Veganuary (January 2019) special menu and was so in love .   The prices are also alright. They often offer specials that you can find more information about through Instagram. I'm looking forward to trying brunch there one of these days. It's also right near my house, so I often swing by for to-go orders.

sVEgJ2PpL265PNVn0vGL2A.text: Delicious!  This place rose to the top of my list thanks to Vegans, Baby! and did not disappoint. Even my surly carnivore bro-in-law who was affronted that I took him 15 whole minutes off-Strip was impressed. My sister had the pancakes (perfectly fluffy w/ crispy edges and, according to her, decent vegan butter), I ordered the elotes takis to share (street corn, a little on the junk food side but fresh corn is still fresh corn) and 4 different tacos (dorado, al pastor, mushroom asada, baja - listed in the order I rank them). My BIL ordered 5 tacos, he loved them all! I only tasted the Super Taco which was phenomenal. He would have ordered 5 more tacos if we had let him. Will definitely go back next time I'm in Vegas!  Note- the place is small and casual, order at the front and take a number. Bright, lots of natural light and cute plants, has a very PNW vibe to it in a way that I love.

The Taki elote and the dorado taco were my faves but it was all AMAZING! I wanna bring everyone I know here because I loved it so much . PpFmBDDW0MY3JlIola1mqA.text: So, it took them 35 minutes to make 2 tacos. The staff was too busy socializing with each other or the friends that walked in, to pay attention to their ordering customers. The staff in the kitchen also had no sense of urgency to take care of the customer. If you want good service, go some place else.

qdgUnIrYMY7PG82Ds5CNLQ.text: Super Taco - super good.  That nostalgic Taco Bell double layer taco, but done right with quality ingredients and lots of love.  Was my fiancee's fave.    Baja - Deep fried avocado with plenty of add-ons and a cream sauce that was very light and frothy and just the way to top of this outstanding substitute for a fish taco.  Not that it needs to be a substitute at all, it was way good.    Chorizo - I was a big big fan.  The chorizo flavor was there and I thought it nailed the flavor pretty spot on for the first Taco.  My fiancee thought the flavor was a little off and I thought so too on the 2nd one (so good that I ordered another). But it wasn't so off that I didn't thoroughly enjoy it.    Pastor - a quality replacement for an Al Pastor Taco and very good if you're an al pastor fan.  But I did think the previous tacos above were better.  Again, not that the al pastor wasn't good.  It was.  You wouldn't go wrong by ordering it over the others.    Service was top top notch.   We came for our birthdays and were treated to free dessert which was an almond milk "ice cream".   The flavor was Churro and it was very good.  We also made a mistake during our order and the staff happily hooked us up when making up for OUR mistake.  We tried insisting that we were the ones that screwed up, but they wouldn't let us pay for the correction.  They were so nice!    Definitely going back.

jKRonMs5-A5Zc1G72z1J_g.text: Best vegan Mexican tacos I've had so far and that's comparing it to quite a few, both high-end and fast food. ta-r0C5FD0kqYOzZb0qgUg.text: Being plant based can be frustrating sometimes, especially when you're at a festival or a concert. BLESS Tacotarian for being at Bite of Lv. I can not say enough GREAT things about the carne asada tacos. Holy crap. Probably the BEST Mexican food I've had since switching to Vegetarian. I inhaled 3 at the speed of light, and grudgingly gave my boyfriend a bite so he would believe me on how yummy they were lol. Definitely adding you guys to the top of our date night list!

FoouEabVA52nIxBehZlWLA.text: Tacotarian..what can I say I'm truly blown away!! So incredibly favorful! I've been eating plant based for a year now and haven't found a satisfying taco. This place is set the bar very high for me, it's PHENOMENAL!! The atmosphere is so inviting, the service is so warm and personable. Zia and Skylar were extremely friendly and helpful in making choices from this enticing menu. Once you sink into a bite of this food, it makes you want to try it all! There is a jimaca margarita!! I love this place, truly a gem. It so cute and cozy too, very well decorated.

I28hwiN80tJZjMAqKAl8uw.text: The space is cute and quaint; as though an Asian and Salvadorian got married and decided to open a cafe serving vegan-Mexican cuisine. The interior has elements of Asian aesthetic, yet trendy pizazz as well.   My fave tacos are the one with fried avocado, and the crispy taco. (Sorry forgot the names) Solely vegan options, but they are pretty freaking good. I was also surprised that the prices weren't outrageous like most vegan joints are. I want to try their desserts next time!   Service was a bit slow, and I was only one of 3 customers  in the whole restaurant

q6f8IXmGCjPKmlkoVpgzcA.text: I'm From San Francisco and this is a great place and fantastic flavors. The place was constantly busy and quite enjoyable. On Sundays they have a brunch menu too with live acoustic music. There is a small outdoor patio. On the food my wife and I ordered six different vegan tacos and some extras. The salsa is amazing - that comes with the chips. Tacos de Jamaica were my favorite. And the elote and it's seasoning - were great. They have other Mexican, Southwest Mex etc options.

QXwTpWGpsG1wLqp5IVFUpQ.text: I love the whole vibe of this place! Very cute interior. I love that there are real plants in the place and it has a cozy vibe to it. Today I had the "Cali Burrito" to be specific. .. this is my favorite item of the menu... today, lol. I cant tell you how i will feel next week, but I bet I'll come find out.  The environment is amazing, great playlist, awesome wall paper and decorations. Old Cantinflas movies projecting, takes me back to childhood, I can actually hear my pops laughing as i sit here... which makes it that much more enjoyable.  The people that work here have all been great. And i find the people that come to eat here are open minded, upbeat, and have a great vibe; which makes for a great eating experience.  Tacotarian a complete delight. I will continue to try the vast menu, however, I think im set with the Cali Burrito. Thank you to those the work there to bring a most excellent experience.

0MmDIWD1CWrsySxWvh7RJg.text: The restaurant is a modern Mexican eatery. It's a order at window and you're given a number to take your own seating. Green enchiladas weren't are favorite. They use mash potatoes instead of some protein..green sauce could have used more seasoning as well.  We had the free iced water self serve. They put limes with the pitcher.  Overall if I'm in the area I'll return for a quick bite but won't go out of my way to come here since we live in southern highlands.  We have a 4 stars because service was stellar and food was good.

bDe4GekRkmjbBtHloau2Ng.text: Delicious! Took my parents here and they didn't even know it was vegan. Best tacos ever. Just love love their food and it's worth the drive from the strip! Have to try!!  Do wish they have you extra plates in case of splitting!  Thanks again!

W8W0XbZSx37Lk37re64Odg.text: Nice, clean, friendly and inexpensive vegan restaurant with plenty of choices. Heck yes!!  This place is so cute inside and super clean, the employees are very friendly and helpful. You have so many taco choices! I had the super taco, jackfruit barbacoa, and the al pastor tacos and the asada fries. Hubs had the cali burrito. The super taco is a fun idea and great if you miss eating the meat tacos at taco bell, it's very similar. The pastor taco is loaded with yummy toppings and the jackfruit taco is sort of sweet. I'd say the pastor was my fave. The asada fries were sooooo good! Crispy fries, the asada is very good and seasoned well and the guac and other toppings were all delicious. Hubs loved his burrito and said the rice and beans on the side were very good. I would love to come back and try all of the tacos and I need to pick up one of those cool Tacotarian hats.

6Wl2GgY76TfsB2wtRgkIiA.text: I would definitely recommend this place to anyone seeking great food and tacos not just the vegetarian/vegan bunch. The freshness and quality of the ingredients they choose means a lot to me and comes through in the food. The staff was wonderful and the restaurant itself is clean and cute.

zBM_O4j1DDkSMQDMS3XS0Q.text: Well, I'm sad because there isn't one of these near me in California. I thoroughly enjoyed myself here! I had three tacos and shared the Taki's Street corn.   Taco One... fried avocado taco. Do I really need to say more? I think I said the three most beautiful words in the English language just now. Flour tortillas with an avocado crema, what seemed like a chipotle aioli and some cabbage on top of a batteries and fried piece of avocado. Awesome.  Taco Two... soyrizo taco. Double corn tortilla and soyrizo. Lots of flavor and spice and just brought me to a happy place.  Taco Three... beyond meat taco. Standard fast food taco made vegan. Lettuce, cheese in a crispy shell. I felt like the flavor could've had a little more seasoning but that's a personal preference. I should have put some cholula on that bad boy.  Taki's Street corn... holy cabooses! This brought me back. Crushed spicy Taki's and cotija with what tasted like a chipotle sauce. Spicy, creamy, crunchy..delish. Order it on or off the cob. Yum.  I should've tried the desserts because..dessert, but I was really full by that time.  I cannot wait to go back.  They do sell margaritas and craft beer as well!   Great Job! You guys need to expand...please, closer to where I live.

youwmKZFJB_nyhZon3kL1A.text: This place is amazing. I have been vegan for a long time and I have to say this is one of my favorite spots. I had the rolled tacos  AMAZING !!! 2e8sTtQ5i4GjD6LVLdFj2w.text: Adorable modern taco shop catering to those who enjoy eating healthy meatless (vegan and vegetarian) fare. Hip and trendy interior design with a wall dedicated to "market" items for sale. Lunch hour was bustling and the ala carte tacos seemed to be the popular vote. I used my Yelp check-in for the free Agua Fresca (ordered the horchata) it was gritty upon the few sips and seemed too watered down, so I stuck with the fruit-infused water. I ordered a side of guacamole and refried beans - they were wonderful, and tried their version of al pastor, veggie and barbacoa tacos - all made to order in mini corn soft tacos. Only $12! I'm excited to try more off the menu and a different Agua Fresca.

DXCY2nmKxaiUzeM2ntVqRQ.text: Today was my first time trying the place out. I'm not vegan or vegetarian but I looked at the menu and everything looked great so I decided to try it out.  1. Mushroom Taco- very delicious and I love the yellow tortilla they used and the salsa roja I added on top really made it taste flavorful. The only thing I didn't like was that there wasn't a lot of mushrooms in my taco, it was two medium sized tortillas with a very small amount of mushrooms in the middle, for $2.95 I think it should have just a tad bit more but other than that I'd definitely order it again.  2. I tried the flautas de papa. OMG. Freaking amazing!!! Iv tried plenty of flautas in my life but these are literally the best Iv ever had. Now Iv made tacos de papa but never with flautas. It's genius. What ever sauce is on top of them is life. I'd like to buy that by the jar please  3. I ordered Jamaica for my drink and again best Iv tried. It was perfectly sweet and just right.  4. The Churros. I was looking forward to trying these since Iv been craving them. Sadly disappointed. They were rock hard. Not fresh whatsoever and I didn't like the chocolate sauce that came with it I prefer caramel. For the price tag of almost $4 I was very sad. Maybe next time they will be better / freshly hot. This is why I can't give it a 5 stars but lm definitely coming back and trying more things. .  The fact that they play Cantinflas through a projector is awesome! If you have ever watched Cantinflas you'll know why. I loved the atmosphere the music the decor. Very clean. Very warm. Everyone was very nice. I was pretty impressed all in all.

yG7DhdXxQoVVEdK9OOUXyg.text: This is place is amazing, I'm already dreaming about the next time I go.  The entire menu is vegan and it's pretty extensive. So many options with their tacos and different proteins. I got a burrito bowl and it was so delicious and filling. I could only eat half and got to bring the rest home. Our server, Tanner, was very kind and helpful in helping me decide what to order. I will definitely be going back to this place.

They have a projector playing black and white movies in the background! They also make their own hot sauces and they get spicy so beware. I've heard the burrito is really good and filling so I'm planning on getting one on my next visit.

muM9Y0xFJkikZcbmKMZEOQ.text: I've already been here twice in the last week. I love their tacos! My boyfriend got the Cali burrito and enjoys it very much! I'm not 100% vegan myself, but this place makes amazing Mexican-vegan cuisine! I just wish that they would make a location closer to home for myself.   I've tried the Chicken Milanesa, Carne Asada, Bean and Cheese, and Gabacho tacos. They are all delicious. The cashew based nacho cheese sauce they use is spot on! The Gabacho is their most famous taco. It truly does resemble a traditional taco with a hard taco shell and they use beyond meat which supposed to simulate ground beef. Worth a try, in my opinion   Please do yourself a favor and give Tacotarian a try! Love the reggae music vibes they got going on that gives a classic taco truck and beach vibe!

6_0v1dIqsgOtRCglRbODBw.text: Lovin' Tacotarian! I've tried almost all of their tacos now, thanks to Taco Tuesday where a good chunk of their taco selections are only $1.99. Tacotarian offers a good selection of vegetable-based options for your taco or burrito craving. Their carne asada fries are bomb- fries are well crisped. Good portions and good prices. I hope to come every Tuesday if I can and during Happy Hour as well!

BBWhCH5AK_8hsgYnx4RPXw.text: Best vegan taco shop in the Southwest area! I'm so excited to have this place literally 3 minutes away from home. Yesterday my husband and I both tried the Cali burrito with al pastor mock meat and we were both surprised on how much they pack into these bad boys. Unlike other reviews that say they don't guacamole to the burrito, they do. Plus they give you a little on the side. Im so bummed I didn't take a picture to show y'all! The burrito is pretty pricey but it's seriously the size of my head and the also give you beans and rice on the side.  Honestly everything tasted well and was made to order. I took my order to go and when I go home everything was still warm. For a vegan burrito this one hit the spot. I've tried so many Mexican vegan places and some do disappoint however I think this place is trying really hard to cater to vegans and non vegans. My husband loved his burrito and he is not vegan.  As far as the service goes, the lady who took my order was very nice, she even gave me sample "meat" to try. Next time we go I really want to try the concha loca because the conchas on display looked amazing! Make sure to check in to get your free agua fresca, unfortunately I paid for mine since I didn't realize they were having this offer. No big deal, until next time!

aqk1j_radmOS_JkbGfoO8A.text: I love tacotarian! I've seen their restaurant jam packed with people on a regular basis. Hopefully they will offer this brunch on Saturday's as well or at least a breakfast burrito option daily because it is sooooo good. This is a fully vegan restaurant with lots of vegan beers and some liquor offerings as well. I've brought several friends and family members here on numerous occasions, none of them vegetarian or vegan, and they all LOVE this place. Things as simple as their black beans are even delicious. I've tried 90% of their menu and there's nothing I wouldn't order again. Favorite menu items are al pastor tacos, chicken milanesa tacos, flautas, california burrito. Brunch items that rock are the breakfast burrito which has delicious sausage and chilaquiles where you can add tofu scramble and meat of choice for $1.50 extra.

_JwcDjG_EWMbjXTDU7-_AA.text: WHAT THE HELL TACOTARIAN!! Why aren't you serving food at the San Gennaro Feast!? I was starving tonight and I had to have nasty ass Ponchos.. it was disgusting. Please represent for the good Vegan/Vegetarian restaurants in Vegas and sell those tacos! Lol!

veHiSojFFF8o0-ZNfogFLQ.text: It's like "Vege-tarian"...right?..., but with Taco! That's cute, but how good could veggie tacos be? Turns out they can be very good!  6 of us came here on a Sunday just before 2pm. It was right after yoga, so we were very hungry and ready to tackle the menu.   Throughout our visit, we were serenaded by a beautiful voice, named Haley, who was performing during their Brunch. We grabbed a table and looked at the menu. It's a simple double-sided menu.  My brother who came here few times before told us that there are always a line during dinner time so I felt lucky that we had seats on the tail-end of their brunch.  It's really quite simple if you know what you want:     1. Go to the counter to order and pay    2. Get the number    3. Grab a seat    4. Wait    5. Enjoy   As this was my first time here, I took my time to grab a table first and take my time with the menu. The service was quick and smooth on out visit, but my brother mentioned it could be slow...a lot slower. So be patient because everything we ordered was delicious and full of flavor.   Would I come back?  Yes...but maybe not to right away. Vegetarian tacos are certainly healthier than stand varieties, just as vegetarian diets may be considerably healthier than carnivorous diets, but I'm not really of fan of carbs, and tacos, for that same reason,...so while I really enjoyed the flavors of the tacos I had, such as the double layered Super Taco...it's not really in my wheelhouse for regular eating. In addition to the Super Taco, I'd also recommend the Baja and the Pastor tacos. So even if I'm not rushing back, It is really great to know that you can eat something so flavorful in vegetarian dishes!!! If you happen to be vegetarian you need to check Tacotarian out! And even if you're not vegetarian, if you like tacos, then you still must check Tacotarian out! Bottom line: Go for it!  -2019 review #1-

R1gbattKZ1jW13v-0shB1g.text: In search for Vegan food that would satisfy both my tummy and my pocket; I came across TACOTARIAN on a whim!!!  I follow a group on Facebook (Las Vegas Vegans) that post recommendation on Vegan eateries through out the valley. One of the followers posted that Tacotarian has $1 taquitos on Wednesday's . Based on this I decided to search in google maps and by the grace of kindness I was just 2 miles away. Called my order for pick-up after reviewing the menu online. I was not disappointed! I can honestly say this is the first meal in the month of being Vegan that has satisfy me entirely! Me and my daughter shared the Carne Asada Fries. The price was amazing $7 dollars and change. The ambiance is lovely, the decor unique, modern, yet cozy.  The reason why the 5th is missing is the following... I am a True believer in not only good food but great guest experience. When I came in no one acknowledged me, did not even make eye contact, I stood for a good minute or two without anyone saying a word. The whole thing was very transactional. It is a shame truly. I hope that on my second visit they make amends.

dlgaPdDH2Wy3e2fHTHVMyg.text: A whole VEGAN menu of Mexican foods!? Yesssss.   After seeing a video about this place on Facebook, i finally decided to check it out and I'm so glad i did! This is in my side of town, so it is very convenient for me.   This is an order first and then sit down restaurant. First, I ordered the sopa de fideo soup. The soup came with a lime and it was delicious! I also ordered the flautas (that comes with rice and beans), they were very good. My boyfriend got the baja taco (beer battered avocado with guacamole and lettuce) he said that is was okay and he liked the al pastor taco a lot better. The California burrito with French fries inside was amazing! The flavors were good and you can tell the food they use is fresh.   One of the employees was passing out coffee kombucha samples to each table that was SO good. That was a nice little bonus!  Pros: decor, clean/bright, music (they had a really cool cover playlist playing), service, WiFi available, instagram "worthy" spot with a sombrero on the wall which is fun, full vegan menu, friendly staff   Cons: can't think of any   Tips** i recommend trying to coffee kombucha   Overall, i can't wait to go back and try more things like the desserts and the elotes!

JCRAFUElCHvHl-hMubZT3g.text: While I'm not now nor will I ever become a vegetarian let alone a vegan, I've always tried to be very open-minded about food.  As a result, the wife and I decided to give Tacotarian a try on a Wednesday afternoon especially since we were both in the mood for something a bit lighter and healthier for lunch.  Plus, I was very curious about Tacotarian's vegan tacos since I do love me some tacos.  Tacotarian possessed a welcoming, bright, cheery, if not a bit quirky, aesthetic that was a welcome antithesis to a Chipotle or Taco Bell.  Orders were taken at the counter.  I had their vegan renditions of Carne Asada, Al Pastor, and Barbacoa tacos.  We shared an order of chips and guacamole.  Our food was delivered out to our table after a brief wait.  The al pastor and barbacoa came closest in terms of appearance and texture to approximating their meat-based counterparts.  It took a real stretch to imagine the vegan carne asada as True carne asada.  That said, the truly important thing to me was its taste.  All three of my tacos were damn tasty, hearty, satisfying, and possessed the requisite spice and seasoning notes that one would expect from meat-based tacos.  In truth, though, my wife's Mushroom Asada taco, which I had a small bite, was pretty amazing and the best of bunch of tacos ordered by the both of us.  While it may not have been made fresh to order, the chunky guacamole was obviously made with fresh ingredients earlier in the day as advertised on the menu.  It looked and tasted good.  Tacotarian really served up a pleasant surprise.  I didn't expect to enjoy it as much as I did.  While it was a tall, frankly impossible, order to imitate actual meat, its vegan alternatives to animal-based proteins were prepared in such a way that it really hit the right flavor note that made for a satisfying experience and, best of all, didn't make me wish it was actual meat.  Tacotarian had a lot more on its menu besides tacos, so I can see myself coming back in the near future to try more.

SeRJPDozTyTH3eZgImkq8g.text: My Son is vegan and as the supportive Mom I try vegan restaurants with him all the time. Tacotarian is one of his favorites here in Vegas. We stopped by today and I can definitely see why he loves their food so much. Everything we ordered was so delicious. We ordered a couple of tacos, guacamole, quesadillas and arroz con leche.  I ordered the carne asada, the barbacoa, the baja and the chorizo taco. I also ordered guacamole to start off because I loooove guacamole. Their guacamole was so fresh and so delicious with some chunks of avocado. I liked the carne asada and chorizo tacos. The flavors were so on point. I have to say my favorite is the baja taco. The deep fried avocado and the sauce on it was just so good. I was too full to eat the barbacoa taco but my son assures me it's yummy. I can't wait to come back to Vegas to visit and eat here again. I love the vibe of the restaurant and the food is delicious!

Photo of Tacotarian - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheese quesadillas

6M0igKFzV_bvD8rPQjRjlw.text: Since they first opened, I have been coming here on a weekly basis. I have tried everything on the menu and there isn't one thing I didn't like. I even have brought a group of my omni friends here and they all enjoyed it!   Faves: cali beyond burrito, tacos al pastor, Jamaica tacos, gabacho, carne asada fries, agua frescas.  Not only is the food amazing but what really shines at Tacotarian is the hospitality.  The recommendations, patience, and genuine sincerity from Regina, Skyler, and Eduardo make me continue coming to support this place. By far one of my favorite restaurants!

fobfvDl-sFRUZm7kIkCmRg.text: I stopped by today on the soft opening. I ordered the barbacoa and plantain con mole tacos with a side of rice. Street taco size. It's good for vegan food. Small rice portion too. The downside is that I waited 20 minutes and I had to remind them of my forgotten order. Today was the first day so looks like they are still trying to get into the swing of service. I recommend the food. I'm sure the service will improve with time. Fingers crossed

mzcDG6gi4GOChbtX_kauzw.text: I love this place. Order the  Carne Asada fries! They are incredible. Awesome vegan food and even if you are not vegan you will love it. My husband is not vegan and he thought the tacos were amazing.

RWHmv1Z3PpdHqQB9UR013g.text: I'm not in any way vegetarian/vegan, but all the tacos I had were delicious! Only thing I noticed, it is very light on the stomach, so I would order at least 4 tacos to fill you up. I had their pineapple mango fresca, which was also pretty good. Would definitely come back!

hveJuT4nOzxhrhqG4146LQ.text: Food = A+  Customer service = A+   I work about 3 miles away for a company that manufactures vegan hair care products.  When I heard Tacotarian was opening nearby and looked at the menu, I knew it was going to be an awesome lunch option for me.   The food didn't disappoint. I ordered a cali burrito, and it was HUGE and delicious!   The employees were really helpful navigating the menu and continued being super friendly even after I ordered when I was just waiting for my food to be prepared.  Decor is really great, as well.

__xQ8oYI5Kt-3apNm0KwMw.text: I'm so happy i found this place! First of all, it's so cute! SoCal/beach vibes! The food was sooo good and it's so awesome that there are so many new and delicious plant based/vegan restaurants! This one did not disappoint! Prices are reasonable too. We ordered bean and cheese tacos, Gabacho, Baja and fries- and we loved everything! Can't wait to go back.

QvzCApdIWixK7ypBI9JsPg.text: Came in randomly since I was on this side of town. I had the seitan and impossible beef tacos. Both were tasty but honestly I wish they had a little more kick. They do have a variety of hot sauces but I thought the "meat portion" should be more seasoned and flavorful that's why they lost a star. I also had a hard time differentiating between the two taco meats. The winner of the meal was definitely the hibiscus margarita. It was soo tasty and refreshing and the salt rim had a sugary sauce underneath that was nice. The vibe inside this place was cute and I love finding local gems in random shopping centers. The staff were friendly and knowledgeable of the menu items. I'd definitely come back

KO21HceWAKu7KpLX-CB3_Q.text: It is nice to have so many taco options in our neighborhood! I think they have some very unique taco options. (I forgot the name) but the one with plantains and mole is so good! I am not a mole fan at all, but the consistency was great and not very sweet, which allowed the plantain to be the star. I am ordering delivery as we speak

KFe5FLvIgMNiEWPBTgqLhg.text: I was super unsure how this place would be because usually vegan food is 1. Overpriced 2. Super bland... BUT TACOTARIAN changes the game!!! The tacos are absolutely exquisite and flavorful beyond words. I legit can't tell that the meat options are vegan. The new chicken milanese taco is soooo yummy and crunchy! Also, I have to rave about the plantain taco because it was the best taco I've ever had hands down. I can't think of another place that has a better taco now that I've had the plantain mole taco. I've also had the enchiladas and California burrito and they are awesome. Even for someone who's not vegan, like myself, I LOVE this place and it makes me consider going vegan because of how good it is here. Everyone needs to try this place ASAP. You have a forever customer in me, Tacotarian!

ncKcn_RpvaKg-IGOE8S8fA.text: I was a little hesitant it being my first time here because I am not a vegan and not sure what to expect. But my expectations were definately exceeded. I got Takis elote and the Super taco both so good definately reccommend and will ve back soon. Yum!

td-jeV1YALLpAGjCBJLh5Q.text: Let me start by saying it's very hard not to give 5 stars! I want this place to do sooooo well! We will be back soon to hopefully change it to a five!   I wish they had better tortillas. Like homemade or higher quality.   El pastor taco: my favorite. Hands down delicious, flavorful and hit the spot.  Gabacho: second favorite. Anyone that says it tastes like a Taco Bell taco is right, but who the hell is bothered by that!  Dorado: classic potato taco with nice crispyness and smooth flavor. Solid choice.  No carne Asada: I wanted to love this. This is always my go to but it fell short. Didn't have that classic spice or citrus notes I was hoping for. I'm sure they will be able to perfect in the next few weeks they are open.  Chicharron: I was expecting it to be fried instead for soft since I know it's reflecting the plant based version of pork fat. Freaked me out to eat lol but wasn't bad. Just needed more spice.  Mushroom asada: I don't like mushroom unless overly flavored and I couldn't take more than a bite of this. Don't take my review of it, I'm biased.   Frito pie: delicious, can't go wrong. Tasty, flavorful and reminds me of childhood.   Takis elote: needed a ton more flavor. I'm a spice person so would have liked either chili powder or more takis. Just fell short for us.   Also their salsa is nice and mild. I will have to ask for some hot stuff next time!   Service hands down was amazing cause they were all so kind and helpful. I see them doing very well. Especially with all the helpful reviews! Thank you for helping the world appreciate plant based food one taco at a time!

q-5oi0S2Q0KQly5zXp5jCQ.text: This place just opened a few days ago and it is very well put together.  Lots of different choices of taco.  All vegan.  I'm not vegan, but I love Mexican food and it's near my house so I thought I'd give it a shot.   First off.  Great customer service.  The owners and chef were there on premises and were friendly and helpful guiding me through the menu.     I like Pancho's vegan tacos, but you really can't compare them to Tacotarian's food.  Pancho's is taqueria style, fake meat, very simple.  Nothing wrong with that.  This place has different sauces and garnishes and veggies and isn't all just seitan fake meat like Pancho's.   Again, nothing wrong with seitan, but this place is just several cuts above.    The nacho cheese sauce is frigging amazing.  I can't believe it's vegan.  I also loved the baja taco and "al pastor".     I loved everything that our table ordered and will surely be back!   There were a few hi lips getting the food, but the place is tiny and it was very busy and they just opened so I give them a pass this time.

s1IgAaJ55RT87Pt8gMnxQw.text: Cant even believe this was all plant based. Got the carne asada tacos and it was unbelievable i will definitely be coming back! Guilt free food option!

I2oUQ-pgqt-BujTfhLoFEw.text: great place for vegan tacos, good  value for food service and friendly atmosphere the staff here were very friendly and invited us into their restaurant we tried 5 different tacos my favorite was the friend avocado and my husband-loved the Jamaican flavors. do yourself a favor and come try this place you won't regret   also if you come on Sunday they have brunch and live music amazing

LfdACOPJ8y2dhyXz9uDBUw.text: This place is amazing! The people are friendly and the selections are wondrous. We all ordered different items and then shared flavors. Customers were bustling in and out while the staff greeted them with uncommonly friendly, relaxed, and friendly place. I wish I wasn't giving such a great review because now I'll have to wait longer to enjoy their delectable dishes!

CVz_CZCgHeWsINDf9_jlmg.text: Great food. Amazing customer service. The guy at the register was so nice and polite. Will definitely be back!

eH7a_V5xA_o872kNXdq4GA.text: Solid 4.5! I am merely docking half a star because of their tortillas and a few other things I'm going to mention.  I'll admit it--I'm a wee bit of a tortilla snob. I think a huge part of what makes good Mexican food is a good tortilla. We ordered three tacos, which were of street taco size, and when they're this size, I expect them to have two layers of tortilla. More importantly, I expect them to be soft. It was half toasted, which is fine because this is merely a preference. In other news, TRY THE AL PASTOR! I think they really nailed that one. My partner enjoys the No Carne Asada taco. The chorizo wasn't bad either.  We also had the Cali burrito with barbacoa--it's made of jackfruit and the flavor and texture is great! It's actually some of the best jackfruit I've ever had at a restaurant. Also, who doesn't love fries in a burrito?! We had some complimentary coffee kombucha which I really enjoyed. For dessert, we tried a chocolate concha with vanilla ice cream and sprinkles. It was a good way to end the meal.   Overall, the only disappointment I had was the lack of pollo as a "meat"/filling and the fact that there is no horchata. Everything else is great! Can't wait to try the churros and the taki elote. The decor is quite lovely, too. We'll definitely be back! ...Wait, did I mention this place 100% vegan? Two thumbs up from me!!

u_Z6689XdZBbbq2-JRf5fg.text: The staff was SO nice. I had never been to an entirely vegan restaurant, despite being vegan, and they were so accommodating making suggestions and giving me samples, without me even asking! Gave me a free drink for my first visit that was so delish. The Baja taco was my favorite, but all were delicious and there are so many options, even a meat eater would find something they'd love. Authentic Mexican food without adding so many strange out-of-place ingredients like some vegan places do.

29KU4zVSm3dracJk67g3_Q.text: So good!! Great plant based option when I'm craving some good Mexican food the tacos are delicious, the Cali burrito is so good, and their guacamole and chips is amazing!!!! Highly recommend to vegans & omnivores

rFxJmYbCIVSTsDciMK5-8Q.text: As far as good vegan, and mexican spots go in the deep south west, theyre pretty much non existent..    So we're super glad that this place checks the two off that list.   Exited to have you !

Mzuvgp0keWWjymUNE29Ipg.text: Woah! Awesome killer craft beer amazing tacos! Had a beyond meat crunchy taco, the mushrooms are cooked perfectly. Everything is seasoned and cooked to perfection. Food comes out super fast. They have margaritas. Deserts. 100% Plant Based no worries of cross contamination for vegans. No dairy. No eggs. No meat. And this stuff is so good if a non vegan comes here. They wouldn't even know. Fritos nachos are rad. I haven't had Fritos since elementary school. The owners and family that work here are great. Seems like a great place to get quick take out. House made salsa with habaneros. Everything was truly great. I can't say enough about this little spot on the west side of Las Vegas that is doing big things.

jMi9k9t2KAlXF3B57zshsg.text: OH EM GEE!  Tacos were awesome.  I'm not a vegan but I will totally be back.  Here are the items I tried: Al pastor taco -  it was really good Gazpacho - A close second  Super taco- hands down my favorite Baja taco - they hit the nail on the head w the flavors. RaoSbYUitTeeDgT3JVvIkw.text: I really love this place . My favorites are the mushroom asada tacos and the enchiladas. The enchiladas have a little spicy kick to them. I'm not a vegan and I was suprised to find out they don't use meat. Had me fooled! I think the food here is just delicious!!

vFeMmSzTrOxbVoi15mTqAw.text: Tacotarian is literally one of the best vegan restaurants I've ever been to. The food is always the same depending on the cooks which is usually hard to find when it comes to local businesses. I'd eat here everyday if I could!!!

CjKjdKbZPhFHwBnd1rb5HQ.text: SO GOOD  I had been following this restaurant on instagram for awhile and i was counting down the days until they opened. the first week i tried it, i went 3 times that same week! So so so good. if you like mexican food and eating plant based goodness that is good for you, the animals, and the environment, then look no further- this is your place! so many options, good sized menu with a lot of variety. my favorites are: the super taco!!! the mushroom taco. the jackfruit taco. whatever you do, order the super taco --- sooo good. and the prices are cheap, so try a few.  cute clean setting with a nice friendly staff who will help answer any questions you have about the menu  i have to tell a story about their service as well. i ordered on postmates the other day- my order was about 12 items total. once i got my order, i looked in the bag and they had forgotten my 4 super tacos!!! i called Tacotarian right away and they were waiting for my call (as they didn't have my number since i ordered through postmates) the lady on the phone was very apologetic, said the tacos we're sitting right there and they we're so sorry about the mistake and asked for my address and said they would deliver the tacos themselves and refund me for the inconvenience. i said a refund wasn't necessary, but gave them my address. 15 minutes later a guy delivered me not only my 4 super tacos- but ALSO 4 extra super tacos as well as two $5 coupons for my next visit. very nice of them to do that as i know it's easy to make mistakes. i just really appreciated how sorry they we're and that they didn't hesitate to make it right- and then some! thank you Tacotarian!!

FajvxQqDAoLvzLD5FAtXbQ.text: Oh my lord I found my new favorite spot to eat in Las Vegas. Let me start off by saying I'm a pescatarian and my husband is a meat lover. I saw my friend post about this place on Instagram and I knew I would have to try it. I had 3 tacos the Gabacho, The Dorado, and the veggie. The Gabacho uses beyond meat and it tasted just like meat! The Dorado was my favorite but all of the tacos I scored 8.9 or higher. My husband got the Cali burrito and loved it! Usually he doesn't like to try vegetarian let alone vegan options so this was a huge win! I also got the strawberry margarita and it was delicious! My only small complaint was the margarita had too much ice. Overall our meals were a 10 and we can't wait to come back!  The ambience/ atmosphere was cozy and modern, you order at the counter and they bring you drinks and your food. Service is very f  I woke up craving my more tacos! I would HIGHLY recommend trying this place even if you are a meat lover!   I forgot to mention we tried all of their ice cream and got the fried Oreos. OH MY LORD I died and went to heaven! I don't even like chocolate and the fried Oreos were one of the best desserts I've EVER had!

tpvkXuAFxb--muIjgnWMpg.text: I barely found out about this place about two weeks ago, and I haven't been addicted to a place to eat in a while! I lost count how many times I have been here in the short few weeks I found the gem, but I have been telling everyone about this place. I am not a Vegan, but I wanted to see how the food tasted. I was raised vegetarian, but I do eat chicken, and getting sick of chicken, I wanted to try this place. My friend and I came here and we both loved it. The flavors are amazing, the tortillas are to die for, and I am not sure what meat, besides chicken, tastes like, but this is the best thing I have ever had. I need to try the other things on the menu, but once I Love something, I usually stick to it. I have tried the al pastor, veggie, dorado, and Baja. All amazing, but hands down the al pastor is my favorite. I could eat this every day for the rest of my life. I will definitely be back, since I just went today. I highly recommend this place!

PZk-r66iUjogKoY0Gyc0NQ.text: So let me start by saying this review pertains to the Pancakes and the Chilaquiles (basically sloppy nachos I guess...LOL). I have a pretty firm rule when it comes to establishments that serve Pancakes...I HAVE TO TRY THEM...LOL...simple rule right. Well, these didn't disappoint and since I had a feeling they only serve them for Sunday Brunch (and I was correct by the way) well I had to try them. While not as good as some Pancakes at I had a Bob's Red Mill in Oregon...these certainly were a close 2nd. They were very light and served with Vegan Butter, Blueberry Compote, and Fresh Fruit...absolutely awesome.  The sausage was not listed as a side dish on the menu but I knew I had to have some with my Pancakes and they, in fact, did have Sausage Links. I had no idea what they were made of or where they came from but they were VEGAN of course and DELICIOUS. The Wife had the Chilaquiles and they were very flavorful and she simply couldn't get enough.   By the way if you check-in on YELP you get your choice of 2 types of Aqua Freshca Drinks.  We will be returning to try some ACTUAL TACOS...LOL and once we do that I will update this review...until then...Eat, Drink, and Be Merry, my Friends!!!!

5H-PR9z7ke2AuP3lL6sYNw.text: Service: The employees here have been extremely friendly and polite with us both times we visited. Honestly this is what determined the extra star. They went above and beyond to make my husband and baby feel comfortable and welcomed.   Food: it was really tasty. I went once during dinner hours and another time for brunch. The first time I ordered asada fries and a carne asada taco. My husband got one taco each from the menu. I loved my asada fries more than the taco if I'm quite honest but I had a bite of a adoba taco which I fell in love with too. I want so impressed my first time as I was during brunch. We had breakfast burritos filled with tofu black beans veggies and vegan sausage which came with a side of potatoes and fruit. The burrito was so savory and filling! We were very impressed and would def recommend to vegans and non Vegans alike!

hhjzHbDJgym4HjPH5hqGSQ.text: Yes, I am a carnivore but am well versed in meatless dishes. I have been an on and off again vegan-vegi since the 80s so I can appreciate good meatless meals.   Tacotarian has fantastic meatless tacos at great prices. They offer several different kinds that are very filling. I ordered the Chicken Milanese, Baja and Gabacho tacos but my favorite was definitely the Gabacho. It is made with ground Beyond Beef and served in a crunchy shell.  Tacotarian also offers other dishes like burritos, enchiladas and guacamole with chips. Don't forget to check in and get your free Agua Fresca!   This is a counter order restaraunt but they will bring the food to your table. The service here is fast and very friendly. The atmosphere is bright, cheery and very family friendly.   There is something for everyone here, even for you carnivores!

NmRUl9x3RWcVhPMWvjF-CA.text: Tacos are so important. Vegan tacos are even more important. I'm so delighted to see so many vegan restaurants popping up around Vegas lately. I experienced the goodness of Tacotarian for the first time today, but I can say with absolute certainty that I'll be back.  Initially, I was very pleased with the amount of drink options available. Aside from a solid selection of booze, they also have bottled drinks such as Mexican Coke and Jarritos. I ordered the Jamaica margarita and it was delightful. However, I will say that the mixologist has a very heavy hand with the tequila and I stumbled around Ikea for the hour proceeding the meal, but may be more of my issue than Tacotarian's... After a thoughtful decision, I ordered the three tacos: the Dorado, Chicken Milanesa, and Plantain con Mole tacos. Not to be dramatic, but I could've eaten many more. I would've been quite uncomfortable and overly full, but this trio was so good that I'm not insatiably curious about the other options and entrees. I've eaten many meatless meals in my day and sometimes I walk away from the table thinking it was merely "meh" and it was missing something, that was NOT the case here. I loved each taco more than the last.  Aside from loving the food and the atmosphere, I also loved the cashier. She was very sweet and helpful in narrowing down the menu. When I was torn between margarita options, she let me sample them. It was truly icing on the cake...errr, Daiya cheese on the vegan taco.

BaRYzsr9JcPCyKzeELKbzQ.text: FAN-tarian  I've been following this hip plant based Mexican joint since pre-opening and I must admit their social media advertisement has been exceptional (I may or may not have licked my screen a few times).   Dorado Taco $1.99 is a delicious deep fried mashed potato with cheese, pico and crema! By far my favorite item.   Veggie Taco $2.50 another mashed potato taco prepared with corn tortillas, onion, lettuce, mushroom and sauce.   Takis Elote $4.95 corn overloaded with smashed Takis was sodium rush and I ended up removing Takis to enjoy the corn better.  Two "out of this universe" tacos definitely did not transform me into a plant-based gurl but I did appreciate and enjoy the great food options available.  I'll be back!

zyX_AoKFL3dDgOCmAv6CxA.text: Wanted to really like this place. But just kind of fell in the middle of the road for me.  The good.   Awesome service. Friendly, greeted right away and if had questions.   Was even offered free chips and salsa for taking a little longer.   Lots of taco options. We ordered 5 different types and ceviche.   Salsas were awesome. Some pretty spicy    Ambiance was cool, almost coffee shop like.   Free aqua Fresca with yelp check in   The ok... Ok sums it up. The flavor of the tacos was missing a pop. The cauliflower ceviche was also ok being more on the bland side. I added some of their mild salsa just to get some flavor.   I personally like sweeter horchatas this was not.   The bad... Tacos came out cold.   Overall, I would give the place another shot to see if it was just an off night before writing it off.

7zDw22IrvlTmv1N8lZqTCQ.text: This place has fantastic vegan Mexican food. They have a broad range of Mexican inspired flavors, from the sweet and savory Al Pastor, to mole, to the salty gabacho which looks and tastes like a Taco Bell taco. Each of their tacos has its own unique flavor and texture, and even the different tortillas they are each served on are delicious.   My favorite taco was the bean and vegan cheese taco. It was served on two soft, warm, chewy yellow corn tortillas, which went perfectly with the smooth and delicious refried pinto beans. The texture and flavor was heavenly.  The gabacho, Al Pastor, Baja, plantain con mole, and super taco were all delicious as well. The tacos are all reasonably priced and it's great that you can order single tacos to sample a wide array of flavors.   Tacotarian has done an incredible job capturing traditional Mexican flavors that are difficult for plant-based diners to find elsewhere. For example, mole sauce almost always has meat stock in it, so this place is a great chance for vegans to try traditional mole enchiladas. The food is so good that I ordered 3 extra tacos to take home and ate them right away.   They serve bottled beer and have some beer on tap. They also have a dessert menu which looks pretty good. I would recommend avoiding the Frito pie. I ordered it and found myself disappointed staring at a bowl full of Frito chips when there was so much good homemade food to be had at this restaurant instead. It was dry and I didn't notice much if any nacho cheese sauce on the Frito pie.  The staff here is friendly and accommodating. It is counter service, but the cashier and cooks try to serve you as much as possible.  Vegans and meat eaters alike should definitely try this place for a plant-based Mexican meal. Bring a huge appetite, order a ton of different taco varieties, and enjoy.

I wouldn't be opposed to coming back and trying different offerings. Maybe today was just an off day with service time and temp. Decor was cute

ngF4p1RJKuwFYDD1AOplZA.text: I really like the adobada tacos. I love the pineapples and savory meat that comes on it. It's a little on the pricier end and the portions are smaller than usual. But I still enjoy the food and recommend it if you are vegan/vegetarian. It's close to authentic Mexican while being vegetarian.

u0ekdTFpBQbeoCOsi-SXdQ.text: I'm a big fan of food holidays- you know, those obnoxious, random days when social media blows up with photos of a specific dish and your email is full to bursting with discount offers all geared toward one item on one arbitrary day? Love 'em. But Meatless Monday and Taco Tuesday are weekly staples for me, and Tacotarian is a great spot to hit up on either of those days.  Tacos here are super fresh and served on corn, in a modern and inviting white and turquoise space. Menu has tacos, burritos, and other assorted Mexican dishes with proteins in the form of vegetables, Seitan, jackfruit, and even Beyond Meat products. The additional toppings on some of the tacos (just cilantro and onion vs cilantro, guac, pineapple, etc) sway my opinion to favor those that are a bit more loaded up.   I would like to try their enchiladas on a future visit but would like a choice of protein other than the current mashed potato filling. Regular prices for some tacos go up to $4 each, which is a bit steep for the small street taco-style size of the product. I do like how they partner with Nourish for their non-dairy ice cream dessert!  TIPS: Don't forget to hit up the salsa bar for some spice, both house-made and bottled options. If you go on a Tuesday, you'll be rewarded with discounts in the form of $1.99 prices on featured tacos!

-HcCncTnJiCaig-t3inxkw.text: Delicious Mexican food that happens to be vegan.   I was introduced to Tacotarian from an event where they were a vendor. During my first visit, shared the nachos and Fritos Pie with my friend. Let me just say that they're prices are amazing. This meal cost us less than $15!   Truth be told, it took me 25 minutes to get home and actually eat the food. Consequently, my nachos were a little soggy and the chips had absorbed the cheese. Not the restaurants fault, so next time I'll eat my food at the restaurant. Now, the Fritos Pie were perfect in spite of the long ride home. For $5.99, you cannot find a better deal. Honesty, the portion size is large enough for two people to share.   The restaurant itself is super-cute and very clean. The staff were very sweet and personable. Looking forward to my next visit, where I'll actually order some tacos!

ytx3Fw65RDtEJYKHoJ6iyA.text: Let's start out by saying, I'm not a Vegan. My friends are and they wanted me to check out this place simply because I love tacos. I'm always game to try new foods, regardless of what it is.   Upon arriving the place is full of light and sunshine. Very welcoming, however the staff that I interacted w/ seemed to be just going through the motions. I tend to say 'hi, how are you?', generally I get a response of 'blah blah, how are you?'. In this interaction the cashier's response was 'how can I help you?' This same scenario happened to my friend. However another person that came up after us, the cashier had an actual conversation w/ the customer. Odd.   I ordered: Carne Asada (Gucamole & pico) Dorado (deep fried mashed potato, cheddar, lettuce, pico and crema)  Baja (Fried beer-battered avocado, cilantro-lime slaw, guac, pico, salsa Morita)  I had to get the Carne Asada to try it. Not sure why they would name it this, if it's a Vegan place. Especially since as I grew up w/ carne asada, I know it as beef. This was the best taco out of those I ordered. Such good flavor. I chose the Dorado mainly to try some deep fried mashed potato. I just wasn't feeling the flavor of this taco. Baja sounded so good, but much like the Dorado, the flavors did mesh for my taste buds.   I was surprised on the turn around time to get my food. It took about 10 minutes. I didn't mind as I was w/ friends and thankfully I wasn't starving, but that's longer than I've had to wait for food at a non vegan taco place.   I will say that they do offer a large selection and variety of food. My friend lives for this place.

6DO366-1ha4Fn_hkbyLXvA.text: My favorite places to come and grab a Cali Burrito. If you never had a Cali Burrito before, this is a good place to try one for the first time.  One of my go to lunch places and so far it hasn't disappointed. They offer a good variety of taco choices as well. Most people come because of the Vegan option, to be honest, I didn't even know it was vegan cause the food tasted amazing.   My friend and I also really enjoyed their Watermelon Fresca. It was cool and refreshing that complemented the heat from the hot sauce I had with my burrito. Highly recommend to those that have not tried!

U_UM6XYLV-XHEqslBbKTOA.text: My first time visiting Tacotarian and let's just say I was blown away! From the ambiance, the service down to each and every taco we ordered.  We had:  Carne Asada  Al pastor  Barbacoa Chorizo  Veggie  Baja  Chicken Milanesa  & last but not least the Gabacho!  All of them had bomb flavor! I'm not vegan whatsoever but I love vegan food! wZF3zjNU37y8C_TZizZKew.text: Absolutely try all of their menu! You wouldn't even know it's not meat. UngiqacUSNG8ZDPavc4IkQ.text: Definitely give this place a try. The atmosphere is really chill. Music was good and they had a projector showing black and white movies which was a cool touch. Ordering was actually easy because our cashier was super knowledgeable about the menu and her product. She made helpful suggestions which lead us to the perfect tacos. Damage was about 25$ with a tip at the register. I'm used to extortion as a vegan and I didn't think the pricing was too high, could be too soon to know for sure though. But we had, soup, 4 tacos, chips and salsa and a sprite for like 22$ so that's not horrible. And we were pretty full in the end. Grabbed a table for two in the corner. It wasn't super busy when we got there at about 5 but I'm sure that will change when people catch on. There is a good amount is seating options also. A high top down the middle with stills and tables around the sides. The place was clean and well thought out as far as branding and decor. There is eve some swag if you're into it. On to the food... only reason for the 4 Star and not a 5 is because something happened in back and the second half of our order came out 40m later. We started with some fideo soup which was awesome. And some salsa and chips which was also grubbin'. But where were those tacos... after they figured out they missed our food it came out in a reasonable time. Well made and delicious. Presentation was great. I always appreciate when my food is put together well. Each taco we tried was really good. Tried 4 different styles and they were all individually good and I didn't find similarities in the ingredients at all. They did a great job there. For sure stop by when you can. Vegan or not you're going to enjoy. I'll defiantly be back soon to explore more of the menu options. There are a bunch. This is more than a taco shop. #grub

FuAEC9LHsE1mVa4EbbtOCQ.text: I love seeing more vegan restaurants popping up all over the map! RRl8g95v5bVjT2kfwOul2w.text: 1st time here ! Loved it. Great plant based food + craft beer . Busy place but worth it. Good coconut cake dessert .

SigXHTU1M3pj7KW4OHlA4A.text: Ok so I wanted to come here a few times before writing my review. I have been three times now and plan to continue supporting this great spot! Being in the restaurant biz myself, I know that that first month or so is a time where you grow and learn and improve, so I have NO doubt in my mind, any "kinks" here will be worked out.  First, Service wise, this is a spot that you can tell, the employees are happy to be working at. This says a lot for the management and owners too. Everyone I've encountered is friendly and knowledgeable and has welcomed me back. They come out and check on you and when the ordering line has been "long" other staff has come out on handheld pos systems and taken orders.  Second, Decor is great! Simple and clean and fun. White with black and teal. Little plants on the tables and just an overall fresh feeling spot.  Third, and most importantly, Food. I have had a good majority of the tacos, a couple starters/sides, one entree and one dessert.  Since I've had so much there, at this stage I'm having a hard time remembering what all I had on what day. But.... for the most part, everything has been great! Some of the tacos are smaller then others but I don't think any are overpriced or disappointing. With prices under $3 on almost every single taco, I don't understand how some people have complained that they are overpriced??? Most tacos are 2.50. What do people expect? This is a business that uses quality ingredients and doesn't pay their employees "sweatshop" wages. How on earth could they charge less for food that has homemade sauces and house pickled items and whatnot. People are crazy if they think 2.50 is overpriced for a good taco. Seriously, stay home or continue eating fast foods $1 menu, if that's your mentality.  Items I've had: Gabacho taco Barbacoa taco Dorado taco Baja taco Chicharron verde taco Plantains con Mole taco Takis Elote Asada Fries Flautas Guacamole Churros   My least favorite thing was the guacamole. I just was left wanting some that was reminiscent of some I know they make elsewhere... My favorites: churros for sure!!!! Also the asada fries are filling and very satisfying. Almost too "meaty" in a way, but great for the non vegans for sure! Flautas were great and something I never order at Mexican restaurants but these were fun and filling! Came with rice and beans and pico and guacamole. Taco wise, I loved the Gabacho. Yes it is that standard taco that makes you think of having taco nite back in the day with the fam. Hard shell with the lettuce cheese and meat. The Plantain was flavorful and fun. And the chicharron was surprisingly good! I have NEVER liked chicharron before (when I ate meat) so wasn't sure how I'd like this, but it was great!  I wish the takis elote had more cilantro. But I will admit I am a cilantro fiend so....  They now have their alcohol license so beers will make dinner (or lunch) complete!  I definitely recommend checking this place out, whether you eat meat or not. I also think the owners for opening on the south west, so that all of us do not have to drive to the Eastside for vegan tacos anymore!!!!

qj4Z49zYBEGZyD47MktgfA.text: Alright people, get on board! If you haven't been here yet you are MISSING OUT - first of all I want to say that after a long day of getting beat up at work, finishing my day with a visit to tacotarian is HEAVEN. With that out of the way, I want to say every taco here is amazing but my favorite is the GABACHO - classic loaded crunchy taco! You can't go wrong!!!   You cannot forget an Asada fries either! They're an essential part of my trip here. Everything is so good though!! That definitely makes things a bit more difficult so you'll need multiple trips back throughout the week. Don't worry, you'll be just like the rest of us who are now ADDICTED to this place and I drive here aaaaallll the way from summerlin!   Last, but not least - DESSERT - you cannot leave without the coconut cake- it's quintessential- it's all creamy and rich but milky like a Tres leches and there's caramel.... oooh the caramel, get a scoop of vanilla ice cream if they have and ask for extra caramel- you'll thank me later.   See you next time TACOTARIAN-

VFswALDMAI3QCmOdmSuw0A.text: I've been wanting to come here to try the Cali burrito with jackfruit. I was expecting something similar to seriously flavorful  pulled pork but when I bit into the burrito, there were large chunks of jackfruit  that didn't taste anything like the "meat" it's pretending to be. I was disappointed for sure, the chunks were very off-putting. Also, the inside of the burrito was so runny, it was like soupy mush (baby food texture). There was no density to it, when I bit the left side,  the ingredients on the right side spilled out, I bit the right and the left side spilled out. It was an unpleasant mess that I just couldn't finish. 1/5  Asada fries - this was a last minute addition to the order and boy am I glad we did. I'll come back over and over just for this alone. Perfectly crunchy fries, meat flavor was amazing, just great! 5/5  Mushroom tacos were okay, not bad, not great... There wasn't much flavor, I probably won't try them again. 3/5  Horchata was good and refreshing, margarita was tasty but I couldn't tell there was alcohol. The place is super cute and hip, reminds me of LA. I'll definitely be back to try more of the menu and to get more asada fries.

IkojyM8aQlw7YIWAEAsBJg.text: I'm here in Vegas visiting my family and I find this place. My family said they've never eaten here before so we agree to hit it up for dinner after a long day of swimming.   Very good.  I ordered 3 chicken tacos, a taco de jamaica and the carne asada fries with a strawberry margarita rimmed with tahin. I thoroughly enjoyed ALL OF IT!!   To top it off, the staff was hella friendly and very prompt with bringing us our food, packaging for our leftovers and clearing the table.  The decor is simple but cute and I love the tiling at the counter!  This is a spot I'm definitely going to visit again when I come to Vegas.  Great job guys

gGWtZ6xABcTzqvLn_DE9pw.text: I'm not even vegan, like not even close, and this place DOES IT for me! It's so tasty!   Yooo I'm gonna hook you up with some Tips:  Al pastor tacos  mushroom asada tacos  Gabacho tacos   ALL FIRE! I feel satisfied eating them even though it's 100% vegan! The imitation flavor is phenomenal!   I also ordered the asada fries (not a huge fan! But still good) the cauliflower ceviche, pretty bomb and lastly, the plantain tacos (sweet and savory! If you know me, both flavors don't belong on one dish imo)   So good I've eaten at this place 3x in one week!  Yolo

CKZTz9HlkkXg6wtW7SOvfQ.text: I came here because a friend of mine was vegan...for a few months. They have a strict policy about bringing non-vegan food items in the restaurant. I do enjoy vegan dishes every now and then.  The tacos are priced by the piece and they have a good price point. Ranging from $2-3.50 per taco. You can definitely try different tacos for a reasonable price. And so, I took the liberty to try as many tacos as I possibly can + dessert!  Carne Asada: 3/5 Al Pastor: 3/5 Dorado: 5/5 Mushroom Asada: 5/5 Barbacoa: 4/5 Fried Oreos: 3/5  The restaurant is small but clean. I say give this place a try whether you're vegan or not.

qaYvKKDvuQELXMDAsybTsQ.text: i mean ya but nah?  This place definitely captured what they were going for, but this isn't my type of place.   This is a mix of Taco Bell, Del Taco, and a touch of the corner taco shop. Nacho flavored shredded cheese, hard shell in a soft shell taco, ground v meat. It all wasn't bad, don't get me wrong, but I don't enjoy Taco Bell at all. Del Taco has Beyond Meat, and I've thoroughly enjoyed a hearty Beyond Meat burrito from them.   The soft shell jackfruit taco was probably the one that shined the most. I enjoyed the jamaica mixed with watermelon fresca. It wasn't overtly sweet, and had a nice flavor.

photos.caption: Photo of Tacotarian - Las Vegas, NV, United States

J-dlSoMToy8djw6fPNO24Q.text: Many thanks to my lovely Vegan friend for showing me this taco spot! The staff at this establishment is phenomenal, especially Laura who is always kind and quick to address any questions we may have regarding the menu items. Currently I'm addicted to their agua frescas, soy chorizo taco, and cauliflower ceviche. Try them all and I promise you won't be disappointed!

XIIKjuU3jlSzXkWVp4JjWQ.text: Let me start with HELL FREAKING YASSSS!! Like I said before I'm not Vegan, but I looove Vegan food! Bestie was in town and she's a vegan, so we looked this place up. The decor is super cute and the music is bangin!   First off the prices are fantastic! Taco Tuesdays has even better deals. We ordered carne asada, pastor, and plantain tacos. We also ordered Takis Elote and fried Oreos. All I can say is the food was delicious, the staff was amazing, and overall we enjoyed our first experience.   We have no complaints. Hubby said this is going to be our taco Tuesday spot lol. Oh and they serve beer and margaritas, which is another reason why hubby likes this place. I think me and the ladies might try out the Sunday brunch soon so stay tuned for that review.

Vc7l2f2iqGrJ-uJG5LMG0Q.text: Currently my favorite Vegan restaurant in Vegas! I've told everyone about this restaurant and how great their tacos are. I've mainly tried the vegetarian ones with vegetables  (not the ones with the fake meat because I don't eat gluten). The baja, bean and cheese, jamaica, plantain, veggie, dorado, and mushroom. They are all outstanding! I love their enchiladas, rice, and beans too. All seasoned perfectly. I wish the enchiladas had more veggies instead of mashed potatoes though so it's less on the carbs. The baja taco makes you think you're eating a fish taco! Outstanding jamaica margarita!  Service is always friendly and good here.   The minus one star was for the burrito which completely fell apart at first bite and inside was like soup. I've had great vegetarian burritos with lots of veggies but this burrito doesn't hit the mark.

wZ6UoU9pjz5LKoYzqcXdIQ.text: This place is extremely delicious and it's all vegan! Right after my first bite, I told myself I would come back lol.  There are so many tacos to choose from! But I ended up ordering an enchilada plate as my first time try because I really wanted the sides of rice and beans. And my boyfriend ordered the cali burrito. We both each decided to try one taco as well. I got the Baja and he got the gabacho! The gabacho taco was so so so good! The meat is absolutely the best!  The Baja was light zesty and refreshing.  My enchilada was so filling I definitely couldn't finish it but my tummy is so happy! Lol   I like spicy and tried their sauces they had next to the water station, but the one on the table is the best!   Happy hour starts at 3 so we just missed it but it tacos and drinks which is cool!  Service is really friendly! And the restaurant itself is just so cute! All the decorations are eye catching!   Can't wait to go back! My new fav spot!

qAjjJT4gwMnLpqJKr6gR7A.text: I've had this on my to try list for awhile. This place is delicious! Sometimes when I go to vegan spots, I get really put off by the cheese or sometimes the "meat" substitutes have a weird taste to me. This is definitely not what happened here. My boyfriend got the California burrito. Honestly, we couldn't even tell there wasn't real meat in there. I loved the "carne Asada" fries.   The horchata was also super refreshing.   The staff was very friendly and it's def a cool place to sit down and have a meal. I loved this place way more than some other vegan spots I've tried.

eEomTc8qDw7YdjPBJo6N0Q.text: Street food meets casual dining with a cool vibe!  My family and I were in the mood for some tacos and were super excited to finally try Tacotarian! We came in on a Saturday night and although it wasn't a super huge space, it was pretty packed! Luckily, we found a corner spot where we could fit our stroller.   My husband saved our seats while I decided to order practically everything on the menu! The lady at the register was super helpful with giving me some ideas on what to try and what's popular.   Not only is everything super affordable, but there's a lot of diversity on the menu! From the beer battered avacado tacos, (my favorite because that crunch and sauce on top is bomb) to the jackfruit and beyond meat options, they have something for everyone!  Everything came out super fast, fresh, and warm, and we appreciated the complimentary and flavorful cucumber water. We finished our meal with the delicious, cinnamon churros, which were served with a type of caramel sauce.  I believe we ordered about 8 tacos and that was plenty for the two of us! I really should have stopped at three...but I really wanted to try more!  Our bill was less than a typical night out and yet we were super full and satisfied! The best part of all was knowing there were no animals harmed in the making of our food! We'll definitely be back!
