Photo of Tacotarian - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Churros
Photo of Tacotarian - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fact.

zhznSDglmw5uEOl_3ziBLQ.text: This place was simply amazing! I totally loved everything we tasted. I started by drinking a very delicious chia, cucumber agua fresca while waiting for my friends to arrive. We had a plant based carne asada burrito, a plantain taco, cauliflower ceviche (it tasted just like the real deal), and the enchiladas. Every single item was prepared in a way that I thought I was having real meat and cheese. As a non vegan I was very pleased, I would highly recommend this place is you want to try vegan/plant based dishes that are full of flavor. Nothing was boring! Staff was friendly and informative.

photos.caption: Photo of Tacotarian - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu

Ha2DEh5-O5jQeTSqdE6R0g.text: Cute hipster trendy  I enjoyed my experience at this cute little joint. Free WiFi, tables are combination of low and high tops, complimentary water.   Today I tried the sopa, and then the dorado and Baja taco. Yes to all!   The sopa was tasty. Had a little secret chili kick after a few sips. Fresh little bits of cilantro but not overpowering. It was my perfect starter.   Dorado was interesting. I thought "mashed potato?!" And as expected it's straight up a mashed potato crunchy taco but somehow it works haha   Baja was flavorful and fresh tasting. It's funny cause it's a guac on avocado taco but you know what?? ..As a lover of avocado everything...yes.   Hubby had the Cali burrito with chicken. He said he liked that it was fresh tasting. He used words like Tex mex feeling but strong natural flavors. He mentioned he didn't feel stuffed which is great cause we wanted something on the lighter feeling side.

photos.caption: Photo of Tacotarian - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dorado Taco
Photo of Tacotarian - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Baja Taco

WnFrgdCcaoZG9hgBr0LXxQ.text: When it doesn't matter that your tacos are vegan, because they are tasty enough for everybody to enjoy you are doing something incredibly right! Six members of our extended family, including a vegetarian, a couple pescatarians, and a few typical eaters came in recently...and in the end, we were all very satisfied with our meal.  In addition to one of the best names around, Tacotarian is a vegan taco spot with a trendy interior and some of the best vegan tacos around. If tacos aren't really your thing, brunch is always a popular choice for regulars, offering a wider variety of options. Outside of brunch, the menu consists of an abundance of tacos, as well as several related options, such as burritos, nachos, quesadillas, and the like. Some refreshing agua frescas and complementary infused water are perfect for everyone, but those enticed by a cervesas pairing will be pleased as well.  After trying most of the tacos on the menu, I've zeroed in on my favorites: Super, Pastor, Baja, and Veggie.  Admittedly, carnivores may not enjoy Tacotarian as much as their favorite taco spot, but in our group at least, no one felt like they were settling for inferior food either.

sNDnsdRzV66SE15nvJF6tA.text: Delicious vegan tacos that are flavorful, adequately portioned, and filling! They also have bomb margaritas that have Hispanic-flavored twists. A must-try if you either A) are vegan/vegetarian, or B) love tacos/Hispanic food.  Hint: Get the BAJA TACO....literally love at first bite

photos.caption: Photo of Tacotarian - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Al Pastor, Asada, Baja tacos, margarita

fGtNPlZ8scP57pkgOUHoxw.text: This place is AMAZING. The menu offers over 10 kind of tacos and other authentic Mexican eats that are 100% vegan. We sampled 5 different tacos and each packed a punch of plant based flavor, as well as the takis elotes *which is to die for*. Definitely will recommend to my vegan AND non vegan friends. They also offer a great Sunday brunch and week day happy hour specials that I will be sure to catch in the future!

photos.caption: Photo of Tacotarian - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Takis Elote

7xqyoa8GflKx2-8i6_Xusw.text: 3 stars for the environment which was very cute, the service was good as well with one exception...when I walked up to order the cashier was very friendly but standing next to him was a lady with blonde hair who had extreme stank face who was just staring at me...she couldn't even crack a smile which was pretty off putting.  As far as the food goes the tacos were lacking in flavor, pretty much tasted exactly the same and the tortilla shells were stale. The rice and beans had nice flavor but were luke warm. If you're looking for a great vegan alternative to Mexican food, this isn't it....it has no authentic Mexican flavor to it at all. Vegan Mexican food CAN taste authentic but you need to know how to season and use fresh herbs and veggies. Everything was just super bland and it didn't feel like there was any love put into the food....I'm not inspired to return.

5PlxG9FSUA9Wo-eO_QVd1A.text: This is by far my favorite vegan taco house and in my top 3 restaurants all time. WAY TO GO GUYS!! Do not wait!  Go Now!

7-r5d7r8FaaKY1XhOfvd9w.text: Absolutely a great place to eat. I love the theme and the workers are friendly. Great place !

rrwECGGPaqEamStBHkIR-w.text: This is my go to spot for vegan Mexican food! I love the decor and the service is great. It's takes awhile to get your order because they seem to always be busy. Have a little patience and reward yourself with a portobello taco or any of their other fantastic dishes.

WuVawzs587vxam1Z_ZrCtg.text: EVERY SINGLE TACO IS MINDBLOWING! Happy hour from 4-6pm with $5 margs that were super delicious! They were perfect combination of tequila and mix (not drowned in syrup) and the strawberry margarita has bits of real strawbs in it! YUM. My favorite tacos are the chicken milanesa, dorado and gabacho. We also had plaintain tamales which were also super delish. I hear they have 99 cent tacos every Wednesday. I gotta come back and try their enchiladas. Super cute restaurant with cute decorations and a big sombrero for Instagram worthy posts. Will definitely be back soon. I just wish they were closer to me (*cough open another location in Henderson!*)

oiaCNb2L2vut7KesaggclQ.text: Soooooooo good! I had the al pastor, carne asada and chicken tinga tacos with a side of beans & rice. The employees were very welcoming and the atmosphere was awesome. I'm from out of town but I will definitely make it a priority to stop by when I'm in town!

My favorites include...  -Margaritas are on point  -Quesadilla  -Frito pie  -Crunchy potato taco -Super taco    I can't think of a single improvement. It's that good!

9mBSmNHtK6hCjR_ykXTFwA.text: They definitely went above and beyond today I wasn't totally satisfied with something in my order and they replaced it and give me a drink and completely went out of their way and I just wanted to tell them for the next customer! I'm forever a customer

byZdLhaFO3VHf0V9eAXFRA.text: This quaint Taco joint has stolen my heart. As a native to SoCal I am very picky when it comes to tacos but Tacotarian is on to something. I love the variety of options and that they are plant-based. There is no shortage on flavor here and you won't miss the meat. The decor is inviting and simplistic, and seating is a bit limited. I've been twice around 9 pm and the wait was about 15-20 min. The staff is friendly and informative. I was gonna mention parking but I remembered this isn't LA! Lol. Enjoy your tacos!!!!

Z-ri1ygL5yUtE1FpHHW0mQ.text: Food so fresh and delicious it makes the chickens and cows sing! It's that finger-licking good.

FMNCPMwadpT_n2jbaCn_yg.text: Tacos? I'm in!   It doesn't matter if you're vegan, vegetarian or a carnivore. Go try these delicious tacos. There are sixteen different types. So far I tried the El Pastor, Baja and veggie. All were Nom city! I have been back at least four times since my first visit and I can't get bored with the flavor explosions my mouth oh so enjoys.   Try the guacamole too. It's the best I've ever had. The perfect combination of ingredients topped on a delicious crunchy tortilla chip? YaaaaasKweeen!

ovlg4DFa2nmpH3Y_Yruq5Q.text: Vegans and non-vegans alike become regulars of this cute and quaint little spot off Fort Apache and Patrick.  These are hands down some of the best vegan tacos I have ever had.    My favorite is the Super Taco - which, if you're a carnivore, you definitely won't be able to tell that this is vegan.  The flavor is so on point, sometimes this is the only taco I order.  When I'm trying to eat healthier I reach for the Barbacoa (jackfruit) or the Mushroom Asada.    I haven't tried their Sunday Brunch yet but I hope to soon!   I'm so glad it's close by where we live - I hope they continue to do well because having vegan tacos in my life raises the quality of my life for realz :)

tX3MoppdV6vFRLilLoDUbQ.text: Absolutely wonderful. I applaud this group for taking the leap into a business offering clean, fresh, plant based choices for the masses at affordable prices. No reason why one has to break the bank for something that's healthier for all (people,planet, and all animals).   - fabulous interior  - friendly and welcoming staff - food and drink (non and with alcohol)   Keep it up.

ASzbjQ4Uc9jApEpE4432QA.text: So glad this opened in Las Vegas!  1) Cute and casual ambiance 2) Super affordable menu 3) Delicious offerings 4) Helpful and friendly staff 5) Authentic Mexican flavors 6) Extensive menu 7) Nice dessert and beverage offerings  I had a mango agua fresca that was very subtly sweetened as well as three tacos: veggie (the mashed potatoes took it a whole new level), seitan "chicharron" (nailed the flavor and texture) and plantain and mole with pickled red onions (my favorite).  Will definitely come back.

eGS3xZbn3jytSj22gm84iw.text: This place is amazing!!! I'm new to the whole vegan thing, and after eating here, I didn't miss the meat one bit. I had the veggie taco and the mushroom taco, my hubby had the "carne asada" burrito, we shared the the carne asada fries and the taki elote (out of this world, by the way), and my kiddos had the cheese quesadilla and the nachos. All were absolutely incredible. Who knew vegan food could be so good!! But now that I know,  We will definitely be back here often. I can't wait to try the other items on the menu!

GYmOPUx0yt7vmJ-BEbSm5Q.text: Wow! This place is delicious! I tried the Gabacho Tacos! Sooo good! I asked for their hottest salsa and wow that stuff packed a punch! I'll be coming back for sure!

XpP-9vGp61NRMGQGcWaJFQ.text: Yum yum yum!! What a cute spot with great Vegan Mexican Food!  I saw the Cali burrito posted online so of course I had to have it! Wow it was sooo delicious!!  The menu is perfect. I wanted to try more but was so full. Hubby got Gabachos and they were amazing. Our daughter had a quesadilla and it was really good too.  The drink selection is perfect to.  They have Craft Beer and one was called Plant Based Drippin which is a Vegan Beer.  We also tried the margaritas and those were bomb tooo.  All I can say is this is a must stop if you want some amazing Began Mexican food.

OrSRMbAt9MyX2xOPp7PYvA.text: I walked in expecting to love everything about this place but was really disappointed. And i can't believe how positive the reviews are, maybe we went on a bad day. I ordered the flautas, a tea, and a concha.  The flautas lacked overall flavor and the tortillas tasted like a stale store bought tortilla.  The tea was delicious but the kind I ordered escapes my memory.  The concha. SO BAD. It was really stale, like my 13 month had a hard time eating the pieces I tore off stale. It lacked any flavor or sweetness. And the blue color dye they use on them is awful, stained our teeth. You would think that a plant based restaurant would use natural food coloring methods.   I also had a bite of an al pastor taco, flavor was alright, nothing to write home over. I also had a bite of the takis elote and the flavor was really funky, not a fan at all, they cooked the corn off or something. I couldn't quite put my finger on why it was so odd.  Overall I was really disappointed. Everything lacked flavor and more importantly everything lacked Mexican flavor. Which is puzzling, everyone that worked there was clearly Hispanic, they all spoke Spanish to each other so I have no idea how the flavors were so off.  Not worth the 30 miles round trip to get there. There are plenty of other Mexican vegan joints that do it right.

fVWjVbw3wR-vYZCMrgTvsw.text: First time in Tacotarian, very clean restaurant, top notch costumer service, and the food was out of this world  flavorful, fresh, authentic, delicious!!!! This restaurant will be my new Vegan Mexican food favorite  we had the best experience ever! We're definitely coming back!

ij0ec1cIMV_cfFGs-lRHuQ.text: I've been about three times since they've opened.  So far I've ordered (some of this stuff was shared so don't judge me, okay?) asada fries, frito pie, Cali burrito w/ no carne asada, gabacho taco, barbacoa taco, al pastor taco, and churros.  Everything has been really good.  They also have ice water with fruit available at the counter, which is really nice.  The owner and staff are really friendly and come around to make sure everything is okay.  Another thing I appreciate is I've seen them respond positively to feedback they've received.  I would definitely recommend this place to anyone.

VY_i6oxK0KBuDaPsuyEejw.text: this place is not even a mile away from my house which is bad news for me cause this food is irresistible! ive tried almost every thing on the menu except the desserts and everything has been bomb! my husband is from mexico and has high standards for mexican restaurants and this place is his new favorite! when going here definitely try the asada fries and the enchiladas they're the best!

28Qb09ow-FI_lDWPrVnshQ.text: Visited Tacotarian last night. Food was delicious. Staff was friendly and fast. I can't recommend this place enough. And I'm not even vegan!!

pbOGWDyeiqAVfesNNdwMVA.text: Fantastic yummy burritos, enchiladas, they are vegan yet I promise you'll be back whether youre vegan or not

lfUhuPWqpdR6QeccjPR8UA.text: I had been so excited to have tacotarian open up for months so I went opening day. The staff was very friendly and accommodating and it looked pretty good inside. But when the food came out I was a little let down. The protein in my tacos was so burnt and they were incredibly small for the price you pay. I also really wish the tacos came with a lime and salsa to the side. The nachos were so barren I had mostly tortilla chips with very little toppings, it was also very small for $10. I'll definitely never order the nachos again if they stay that small and toppingless. I'll try some tacos again and see if they can do better, but I might still have to make the drive to Pancho's. I do not mean any of this in a harsh way, just hope to be heard so the business can grow and flourish. I will up my stars the next time I visit if it goes better. I truly hope it does so I don't have to drive so far.

zoffHi_LvkVmdMulfEy1gw.text: Amazing food, leaves you feeling satisfied and you'd forget it's plant based, if that wasn't what you were there for..

EIghPp9VSDlhcllFg5mUQA.text: The food is AMAZINGG! But if you plan on going with a big party for bottomless mimosas don't do it! It is very small and not very organized but the food is bomb!

asc5z-xY6zyd-0tSTe7eDg.text: Got the nachos and the super taco and both were great. I'm not a regular vegan eater but am a lover of Mexican food. Also great beer on tap!

InQa-KSRkdWxz3DXbs_blA.text: I went here yesterday with my fiance and the food was so good! I'm not normally on this side of town and was only down there, because of a little event we attended for a friend, but I'm glad someone mentioned that vegan spot, because we were definitely satisfied. Hope more people show up and try it!

VGgT77CaSLcfccn6ISc5rQ.text: First of  I'm not at all vegan/vegetarian which makes this place very surprising. Everything on their menu is vegan so people who have dietary restrictions makes this menu wonderful. We tried a few different tacos which were all delicious but the one that stood out the most is their super taco. I could easily eat those all day. If no one told you that nothing here had meat or dairy you'd easily not notice the difference. I got a churro for dessert. It was good but the only critique would be the salted coconut caramel dipping sauce that came with it was a bit watery. I think this will be one of my regular taco places from now on.

8J3X_MrPt9xwvSFOh8Ki6A.text: This place is amazing!! Will definitely be recommending to friends. The Cali burrito is delicious. Honestly my new favorite place!!

sFxkSzGhhbY-vi_8ezJsAw.text: Excellent!  Very good quality at a very good price! Not to mention the service is great too. We are not even Vegan but we are taco lovers. We'll be back w friends

yDVswNtjA7W61uDfzI0IQg.text: This place is AWESOME! Everything we ordered was delicious and the staff was super friendly! We really enjoyed our first time eating here and will definitely be back! New local fave :)

9BfcQ5dkNgKwHCjwA8FFbw.text: My Baja tacos were everything!! The flavor was amazing. The lemonade was really good too!! I also enjoyed the chips and salsa. Flavors are on point!! I would've given it five stars but I added to churros to my order and I was disappointed in the price and the product. The caramel sauce paired with the churros was pretty bitter. Is everything again minus the churros.

_gqfWkQ602N0vZLMOBOANw.text: Are you kidding me!! My fiance wanted to go get lunch, I was enjoying the couch, but I wanted to be a nice fiance so I went. Walked in, greeted with the cool hip decor and a bunch of Tacotarians. As soon as I saw the menu I immediately contemplating spending my entire check on everything. We ordered 4 different tacos, chips and salsa, and elotes. I dived right into the carne asada taco, ARE YOU KIDDNG ME! I looked my fiance in the eyes and life was complete. Her beautiful smile and a vegan carne asada taco in my mouth. I didn't stop there, I finished every taco in front of me. Service was great, as I finished one they came and cleaned up the mess. I felt like I was on Henry Ford's general assemble line full of tacos. Once I caught my breathe I texted my family and friends and recommended they come here ASAP. Don't you dare think I didn't want more, I went back in line and ordered more! At this point my fiance thought I was disgusting with how much I had put in my belly in this 15 minute sitting. But with a smile from ear to ear she didn't mind to much. Don't think I ended with tacos, I also ordered the churros. ARE YOU KIDDING ME! These made the churros at Disneyland look like the adventure dome at circus circus. Thank Tacotarian for the experience and I will be back! ARE YOU KIDDING ME!! Let's goooo!!

QBdQbHe0HYvCPBHfWiZJkA.text: This place is amazing and my 3 young children love it. We are regulars now. Baja and Derado tacos are my favorite.

2CPTaWHwn5gK5_XO9lT_Nw.text: It just opens a month ago and really I'm in love with this place delicious Vegan food ( if you are not vegan you will never notice it's not beef but plants in your tacos) their Jamaican horchata is perfect really a place to try.

ExrTKO9oqphgVZRzVCux3g.text: Hands down one of the most exciting new spots in all of Vegas! An instant classic that I will frequent for years to come. Frito Pie for President! YUMTOWN!!!!

Will be back as soon as possible!!

WpItigqKQ_QNZXHk6aiRqw.text: My new favorite vegan spot in Vegas! Loads of tacos to chose from and a great variety of larger bites such as nachos, enchiladas, ect. But don't pass up on dessert! Those CHURROS! Amazing. We will be back!

b-IYjnJRzSZ16hrkDW_7Pw.text: I am writing this review as I finished my plate of tacos. I'm still in the restaurant drinking my Jamaica, there are old movies projecting on the wall in front of me, I am full and I am happy.  The decor of this place is beautiful. If you told me this was their first business I would be INCREDIBLY shocked. No detail was left unthought of and the place is themed meticulously. Once again, this place is beautiful.  I ordered the Mushroom Asada, the Al Pastor, and the Dorado taco.  The Al Pastor was seasoned wonderfully, the texture was perfect, the sauce was just enough sauce and if you gave this to me and didn't tell me it was vegan, I'd believe you. Some vegans might be weirded out about the texture or the meatiness of the taco, this is your warning, all of the meats are incredibly believable.  The mushroom asada was good, not great, but that's because it felt familiar to me, a meat eater. This was a classic taco and it did the job. I'd order again.  The dorado taco was hands down my favorite. I have a soft spot for mashed potato tacos, I used to eat them in Denver and they've always been a favorite for me. The salsa on this taco was amazing. Everything about this taco was perfect and I will be ordering this taco every time I come, even if I don't think I want it, I need it.   I love the trend of vegan taco places opening up and I want to eat at all of them, however this will be my go to because it's so close to my house and the all around experience was near perfect

BIVFsYDsk5GSZOareSUgJg.text: Their food is amazing, their customer service is great, their restaurant is clean, overall best place to go to. I tried their tacos carna asada fries and the Cali burrito. So far I love everything here I just wish there was another location in Henderson because I live 40 minutes out and I would come everyday if iwasint. I need to come back and try more things since I've been ignoring Mexican meat-based fare for so long, I don't know what half of it is.

photos.caption: Photo of Tacotarian - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tacotarian salad= yummy

EoElZ-v2LHKLG4RY7vc3wg.text: Been here 3 times since they opened a few weeks ago! It's so amazing. The food is so flavorful and the menu is so unique. They have so many tacos I love coming back and trying new things.  the plantain con mole is the most unique and one of my favs! I've also tried the Asada Fries which Are loaded with carne asada, nacho cheese guac , pico and sour cream. Even though they are fully loaded the fries Are thick and crispy and they don't get soggy like some other places in town. My all time fav though has to be the Cali burrito! It's huuuuge and you can pick whatever "meat" you want. I always get it with the pastor meat bc i love pineapple.   Overall i think the portions are fantastic for the price. I see other people reviewed that the tacos are small but if you go to Mexico these are what street tacos look like. I'm willing to pay a little more for good quality ingredients. But i feel these prices are reasonable.   The burritos come with rice and beans which i can never finish. I would say get a burrito to split and then order a bunch of tacos so you can try more of the menu.   The decor is super cute with old black and white Mexican movies playing on the wall. The music and vibe are 5 star as well.   The staff is so friendly and accommodating. When i ask for suggestions they genuinely seem excited to give me their recommendations. Everyone seems happy to be there.   I look forward to coming back often because i live in the neighborhood and now they have margaritas which i can't wait to try!

photos.caption: Photo of Tacotarian - Las Vegas, NV, United States. They put a little California flag on the Cali burrito, it&#39;s adorable.
Photo of Tacotarian - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Drink menu! So pretty

BTqj-NjZcV8Ukms2d9Jn2Q.text: Vegan or Not, this food hits the spot! Asada fries are bomb and the chilaquiles for sunday brunch are fire too!

FRS0aT8nYn6x7BqIQvTX_Q.text: I have been to one other Vegan Mexican restaurant and that was Gracias Madre in The City....There, they had a lot of dishes that used different ingredient in which I was impressed in so I was excited about this. We ordered:   Mushroom Asada - small ass taco with just asada seasoned baby mushrooms on top....  Dorado - Ok however the flavor was really bland...should have added some type of sauce to this...  Al Pastor - I personally thought like it tasted like Al Pastor however some people didn't..really good as an "alternative" but some vegans may not want that meat flavor...  Plantain con Mole - Personally not a fan of mole however we agreed that this was the most impressive taco that we had...should have ordered the Baja....  Takis Elote - Good as elotes can be  Concha Loca - Really good..light and sweet but not sweet to the point where you feel guilty of eating it  Tacotarian is good and if Yelp allowed .5 star increments, this would be a 3.5/5....I am glad they are pushing a different idea or concept of Mexican cuisine however the prices, the size of the tacos, and the bar that Gracias Madre set for me mentally when it comes to Plant-Based Mexican Cuisine makes it tough to fully recommend it.

c6XH0HImUoeSLdneLx78gA.text: Wow! This place is awesome! I highly recommend, um, everything on the menu. But today my order happened to be the Calo Burrito w/vegan carne asada, and three tacos (Plantain con Mole, Veggie, & Barbacoa). My wife had the Arepas con Soyrizo y Papas and she let me have a bite, and it was good.  We also had two drinks, vegan horchata and jamaica.   I made the decision to go vegan a little over a year and a half ago, and I'm still discovering new vegan-only restaurants. I'm glad I found Tacotarian because it's now one of my new favorites. I wish they'd open another location near my side of town (Henderson), but until they do I'm content driving out to their current location.   Well done, Tacotarian. Well done.

QYgfLLrEB4L29l6n_cpDWA.text: I've been a vegetarian for over 15 years and never have I come across such a mind blowing selection of vegan options. The prices, the service, the menu, the decor, the location... it's all five star.  I've eaten some questionable vegan cuisine across central and southern Mexico and this place is superior, really-there is NO comparison. I was humored to experience some first time vegan eaters during my visit. If you have any skeptical carnivores in your party or simply just want a one stop shop to feed everyone in your family, this is the joint for you.  Tons of "meat"-like proteins, as well as plant based options. I have sworn off meat outside of seafood and tend to not enjoy meat like textures. With that being said, we ordered 7 different types and really enjoyed them all.  I will often find myself saturating Mexican food in salsa to give it more flavor. All of these tacos can stand alone, all killer good. I found myself swaying more so on the plant based side and and am looking forward to come back and have them again.  I 100% recommend the Taco de Jamaica and the Baja. Just these two tacos alone will keep me coming back for years to come.  Tip- get the chips and salsa because the large side of salsa verde is killer and appears to be different than the salsa that is available on the bar.  This place is far too cool for it's own good and if it ever leaves, I will follow.

5xtMRiDcvRp8P6glzCD4-g.text: Spencer n Tiffany.   Thank for amazing service.  Thank for making a b day for my daughter so special.  And food was delicious.   Customer service is great

oOIjlsMDBVH_X9DtCSzveA.text: Oh, Tacotarian, I came in like a wrecking ball.  Whenever I approach this establishment, I come in hungry and devour as much as I can. I've tried every taco on their list at least twice and I can't pick a favorite! Showcasing classics in a vegan flare: mushroom asada, al pastor, and chorizo, which will leave omnivores scratching their heads, but where Tacotarian really shines is in their clever and creative tacos: Taco de Jamaica (hibiscus that's savory, what?), Plantain con Mole (sweet and savory), Baja Taco (beer-battered and deep fried avocado; beam me up, Scotty).  Tacotarian is a fast-casual cafe with limited seating and its on a first come, first served basis. Not recommend for large parties. On Sundays they have brunch and extend their dining area to the parking lot with perfect patio-ish vibes.  Be sure to ask what their specials are. My last visit I scored cauliflower ceviche. Its tender, citrus-y, and came with beautiful, creamy avocado. Delectable. Their insanely delicious Chicken Milense taco was made into a torta. There are plates of enchiladas, quesadillas, and flautas! Tasty re-imagined sides Takis Elote (street corn re-imagined and muy delicioso!) and takin' it back to junior high lunch with Frito pie.  They offer a slew of Agua Frescas (my fave) with flavors changing daily, Mexican Cokes (yay sugar), beers, and margaritas!   Tacotarian has something for everyone! Delicious, quick, casual, and inspired. One of my all-time favorite joints. Be careful, this place is budget-friendly, innovative and extremely addictive!  Hi, my name is Jessica and I'm a Tacotarian!

WYLhM2UJzm141yg5Li1WJQ.text: DELICIOUS!  The first time we tried Tacotarian, we came back two more times that week. We've tried every taco on the menu, our favorites are the dorado and bean and cheese. The tacos are street taco size so you can eat a few; they do really well in the flavors of each taco, i haven't been disappointed. I'm a huge fan of the Cali burrito with extra fries - it comes with a small salad (dressing is excellent), beans and rice. It's a massive burrito. The fries here are super yummy. The choco taco is a nice change of pace from the majority of vegan ice cream desserts. Most recently I tried the quesadilla and my boyfriends comment was "are you sure this isn't real cheese?" Honestly you can't go wrong in whatever you choose here.  The service is decent, it depends on how busy the restaurant is. Staff isn't overly friendly but not rude either - they get the job done. You order at the counter, receive a number then grab a table.  It's a small space with adorable decor, it gets crowded quickly but clears out fairly quickly too.  Happy hour, Taco Tuesday's and Wednesday's are great times to visit here. Vegan tacos for life now! Thanks Tacotarian!

hMf4UUg_0cXt8UKr8cPEJg.text: This place is the best. Every taco is amazing! We love the Dorado and Baja. The employees here are welcoming and the atmosphere is super cute. I hope they open a new location in Henderson area.

bjedIyAjEJuJaUWHUkkE-w.text: Very eclectic place that's worth seeking out and trying. OMG, EVERYTHING VEGAN, I mean Everything!!  They have $1.99 Tacos on Tuesday and other specials throughout the week. It's small, gets extremely crowded but worth it. Definitely an A+ on my list.

6AaznEtN0Dg1eySXJ9yhvw.text: Wow! This place is amazing. The best tacos I have ever had anywhere. It was so good, I had to go back and eat more later in the day. I literally want to go to Vegas just to come here and get some tacos. I was initially a little hesitant of what I should I order since I am a picky eater but I quickly found that everything on the menu is amazing. The service was also fast and friendly.

hmaSOLY6tucuuad0VbObWA.text: This place has the best branding I have seen in a very long time! The food speaks for it self. The only vegan place I can eat at every single day and not get tired of the menu.   On Sundays they bring Ronald's Vegan donuts, which save you a drive to Chinatown if your looking the best Vegan donuts on the planet!   The owner is a stand up guy and works his ass off. We are going to see this company grow in the next five years! I wouldn't be surprised if seen more of these around the valley and then spread to other states. The concept, the menu, the branding at are flawless. I would honestly like to be the one who helps them turn this into the next biggest thing for fast food!  Healthy fast food, and it's amazing!! Game over!!! $$$$$

The staff was also some of the nicest people with a local business feel.  Can't wait to try the restaurant soon!

28Fhq74En-YuFxh_t1ec7A.text: I'd prefer to give it 2.5 stars. Without that option, normally I'd grade-up to 3 stars, but after a lot of thought, I just can't do that in this case.  I'd been anxious to try Tactotarian since first hearing about it long before they opened.  Finally made the drive on a recent Thursday, arriving around 5PM.  Parking was easy, there were a couple customers inside but no wait at the order counter.  I ordered a Barbacoa & a Mushroom taco, a side of chips & guacamole, & a horchata to drink.   Bill total was $15-something -- relatively expensive, so I sure hoped the food was worth it, especially since it was going to be a 24 mile round-trip drive just to try this place.  Guacamole & chips plus the horchata were delivered to my table quickly.  I was immediately disappointed to see how small the cup of Horchata was, based on the price, plus the serving size that I've gotten at all other places that serve it for a similar prices (& some places --not Tacotarian-- are self-serve/free refills). And of course about 40% of the volume of the cup was occupied by ice.  The flavor of Tacotarian's horchata was different than what I'm accustomed to.  Perhaps the Horchata that I've had at dozens of places in Mexico & the USA isn't vegan, & the Horchata at Tacotarian is, but to me, it just didn't taste great.  The guacamole & chips were good -- meaning the chips & guacamole tasted fresh, the guacamole was cool & with a normal bit of seasoning.  A few minutes later, less than 10 minutes after placing my order, the two tacos arrived. Costing about $3 apiece & having no meat in them, you'd expect them to be good-sized.  But any decent Mexican joint or reasonable person would refer to the size Tacotarian served me as mini-Tacos -- about 3 normal, hungry adult bites, & it's gone.  While I'm not vegan, I am a longtime vegetarian as well as longtime consumer of vegetarian & occasionally vegan Mexican food, so my frustration over an abject lack of any Mexican flavor is not actually an adjustment to no meat or chicken flavor or texture in the food, it truly means that there was little to no Mexican flavor, & little flavor at all, until I doused them in the salsa verde that thankfully came with the chips & guacamole.  Part of me would love to come back sometime & try some of their other menu items, but I suspect that's more out of curiosity (Do they have ANY tacos that have decent flavor?), and it's reasonable that if I tried two different types, I'll likely be disappointed by the others.  Even if I did like them, $15 & some change for two *mini-tacos*, some chips & guacamole & a very small, almost flavorless drink is targeting the affluent vegan hipsters from nearby Summerlin, not me.   I'll be very happy to get better tasting food & more of it at Taco y Taco or Chipotle.  Based on my experience, Tacotarian provides OK but overpriced vegan food.  It does not provide good vegan Mexican food nor a good value for your money.

49DdlOjsypMSHdPQmgafzw.text: Awesome vegan Mexican food even for non vegans!! We got about every taco on the menu, and honestly couldn't tell you which is our favorite because they were so good! Their desserts are awesome too! Can't go wrong eating here!

pk29bJ0hCyHKhNh7H5H1YA.text: Not bad. Props for being entirely plant-based.   Been here two days in a row. Wanted to sample a bunch of things before I wrote a review.   No Carne Asada - the soy meat they use has a really odd peppery taste. I've had vegan jerky in the past that has a similar taste. It is not pleasant. It tastes plasticy.   Gabacho - a taco your mom would make. Nothing crazy, but super good. Think a standard Taco Bell taco, but vegan style. The Beyond Meat crumbles on this are amazing.   Barbacoa - I'm not a huge fan of jack fruit, and this didn't change my mind. I do think that jack fruit has a super mild flavor of it's own, and I think this taco didn't do enough to cover up that slightly sour taste and musty taste.   Chorizo - DO IT. DO IT TWICE. Go crazy with this one. It's worth it.   Dorado - Mash potatoes? I'm listening. But on a taco, maybe not. Didn't care for it. The taco shell on this one was slightly fried but soggy? It's supposed to be deep fried. Disclaimer: I did order to go, so possible it was sitting there long than intended.   Staff is very friendly and welcoming. On Tuesdays their tacos are 1.99, so come for that. The value is amazing. Other vegan taco shops in town don't do anything for Taco Tuesday and overall are more expensive. I will continue to eat my way through the menu and report back with my findings.

XVmAWhuPjH8iGGvnEh47Pg.text: I have already spent a small fortune visiting Tacotarian and I am still psyched. 3 Baja, 3 Gabacho, and 3 Dorado tacos please! Every friend and family member that isn't Plant-Based (yet) has absolutely LOVED the food. Super psyched about this approachable venue for everyone to gather around and eat some delicious Mexican food!

z57TknUa1mQiudBpXyGPnw.text: Outstanding.  I am not vegan, vegetarian or otherwise, but my wife has been thinking of giving it a try...so I picked up a surprise lunch for her.  We got Elotes Takis, Baja Tacos, Pastor Tacos, Flautas and Sopa de Fideo.  Everything was delicious and well priced.    Additionally, I accidentally left my wallet there.  One of the chefs found it then located me on facebook to tell me he had it.  I tried to offer him a reward but he simply would not take it.  Pretty amazing experience.  Obviously, I made another large order when I went to get my wallet and again the food was amazing.    This place should crush.

osWMsDAl1YafsYH3GQlx_g.text: I'm in Taco Heaven...I'm not a vegan, I didn't even know it was a vegan joint, I was just yelping "tacos" and it got such good reviews I didn't even check the menu. 2SuIqlZlaAdOx86tJ0AnDg.text: The place is just amazing. The location is nice because it is near a starbucks and other places. The inside looks clean and very trendy. R_snxZfFbhTYUAHnf4QI4Q.text: The world is inundated with Mexican restaurants and almost every kind of variation of Mexican tacos BUT nothing compares to the EXCEPTIONAL taste, variety and downright GENIUS of these VEGAN tacos! As a fellow person from California and as a Mexican-American, I have a profound love for tacos but NONE in California have come close to these VEGAN tacos. I am beyond impressed and can't wait to share my delectable dining experience with friends back home in Northern California. Also- I only write YELP reviews when the restaurants I eat at (and there are a ton) are 5-Star quality in service, taste and personality. This place has it all! Did I mention the owners are absolutely amazing people? They too deserve 5 stars for hospitality, friendliness and professionalism! Will always come back to this place!!!
